### Version history

This page provides information about older or alternative versions of  indicative distribution map for this ecosystem functional group [**{{< meta params.efgname >}}**](/efg-info/F1_7.qmd).
Check the current maps [here](/map-info/F1_7_valid.qmd).

- Indicative Map (**code: F1.7.IM.alt**, version v1.0) discarded 
 - Web navigation (**code: F1.7.web.orig**, version v1.0) requires review 
 - Web navigation (**code: F1.7.WM.nwx**, version v1.0) in preparation 

### Datasets

Datasets considered for previous versions of the indicative map

- **GloRIC-1.0** (Ouellet Dallaire et al. 2018).
 - **HydroRIVERS-V1.0** (Lehner and Grill 2013).

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset          |url                                                           |
|:----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------|
|GloRIC-1.0       |<https://www.hydrosheds.org/page/gloric>{target='links'}      |
|HydroRIVERS-V1.0 |<https://www.hydrosheds.org/page/hydrorivers>{target='links'} |


:::
:::

### Available files

You can download geospatial data for older versions of these maps from the following sources:

**F1.7.web.orig** (v1.0): [GitHub repository](https://github.com/red-list-ecosystem/typology-map-data/blob/master/data/layers/F1.7.web.orig_v1.0.json){target="gisdata"}

Note that you need to login to some services like [mapbox](https://www.mapbox.com){target="links"} or [earthengine](https://earthengine.google.com){target="links"}, and in some cases you also need to request access to the files.

###  License information

Indicative maps have been released with a ![](https://zenodo.org/static/icons/licenses/cc-by-icon.svg){height=20} Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International license. 

But see details of dataset licenses below:

::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}


|dataset          |license_info                                                                                                                                            |
|:----------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|GloRIC-1.0       |freely available for scientific; educational and commercial use :: https://data.hydrosheds.org/file/technical-documentation/HydroSHEDS_TechDoc_v1_4.pdf |
|HydroRIVERS-V1.0 |https://data.hydrosheds.org/file/technical-documentation/HydroSHEDS_TechDoc_v1_4.pdf                                                                    |


:::
:::

## References

References used in these versions of the maps.

- Lehner, B., Grill G. (2013) *Global river hydrography and network routing: baseline data and new approaches to study the world’s large river systems* **Hydrological Processes** 27(15): 2171–2186. Data is available at www.hydrosheds.org. [DOI:10.1002/hyp.9740](http:dx.doi.org/10.1002/hyp.9740) 
 - Ouellet Dallaire, C., Lehner, B., Sayre, R., Thieme, M. (2018): *A multidisciplinary framework to derive global river reach classifications at high spatial resolution*. **Environmental Research Letters** 14: 024003. DOI: [10.1088/1748-9326/aad8e9](https://doi.org/10.1088/1748-9326/aad8e9)
